body: @Switch-vov Please recheck the tests, it fails somehow.

> @wu-sheng Yes, our Grafana UI already has these.

@Switch-vov You don't need to take care of Grafana. It is there. Please follow other comments.

I don't say we don't take care of Spring ecosystem. I mean you still don't explain the real reason why trace breaks.
Plugin dev doc explains the snapshot, and capture/continue operation.

When you add a thing, you should make sure it is compatible with other cases, rather than just give users to choose. SkyWalking never asked you to choose plugin, do we.

> @Switch-vov Please recheck the tests, it fails somehow.

ok.

I don't know whether too many self observability metrics cost all left resources.

@Switch-vov I noticed there is a new PostgreSQL 13 tag updated in dockerhub,  I rolled back to 13.2, https://hub.docker.com/layers/postgres/library/postgres/13.2/images/sha256-933b3327fd8545b1ea60dcf04c38fe6c4a974d48d73aa3771182f21d5e9ad68e?context=explore, which is released in 2 months ago.
Please check whether there is namespace setting, which could make the metric table name longer.

ok. I will rename and test it later.

> > Please check whether there is namespace setting, which could make the metric table name longer.
> 
> ok. I will rename and test it later.

After simplify metrics name.

Run the `org.apache.skywalking.e2e.storage.StorageE2E`.

environment variables: `SW_STORAGE=postgresql; SW_AGENT_JDK_VERSION=8`

The result is:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11993575/126872175-52dd6085-39ab-4237-9442-59915dc42f2e.png)

I think some metric too long for PostgreSQL. Because the default max length of PostgreSQL is 64.

```c
src/include/pg_config_manual.h
#define NAMEDATALEN 64
```
I can see the CI process has confirmed this guess.

Now I'm working on `satellite` testing base on `infra-e2e`, there are still have some `cli` command need to be provided, such as log, CDS, event, profile. I'm trying to working on the `cli` project too. It does not block the replacement process, just some functions.

CLI is a kind of block. Because we have verified the topology already on the current e2e, we at least should keep it.

> > Now I'm working on `satellite` testing base on `infra-e2e`, there are still have some `cli` command need to be provided, such as log, CDS, event, profile. I'm trying to working on the `cli` project too. It does not block the replacement process, just some functions.
> 
> CLI is a kind of block. Because we have verified the topology already on the current e2e, we at least should keep it.

Sure. Then I think the protocol I mentioned above should also be completed before e2e is implemented.
I will try my best to help since I'm interning, and working on GSoC simultaneously.

If there is only a case of across thread, please capture a snapshot in `ConsumerDispatcher#handleDelivery` method, then propagate the context into `executeUnlessShuttingDown` method with a wrapper runnable.
This is the recommended way to process an across thread case.
This is not a bug. We said it is an update, what you were expecting is delete and insert.

> thanks for you reply, i'm afraid that you may misunderstood what id said. what i expect is that when the agent update the instance properties to the oap server for now, the oap server should save the update into the latest indice which is meaningful rather than some older indice, am i right?

No, you are not correct. Once you add a new row, there would be duplicate records in the query, which is not necessary.

> What the bug exactlly is the ES return multiple docs when we search instance_traffiic by id, and we chose a wrong indice to update

Where does a duplicate record come from? We don't insert the entity into the newer index at all.

> > thanks for you reply, i'm afraid that you may misunderstood what id said. what i expect is that when the agent update the instance properties to the oap server for now, the oap server should save the update into the latest indice which is meaningful rather than some older indice, am i right?
> 
> No, you are not correct. Once you add a new row, there would be duplicate records in the query, which is not necessary.

thanks for you reply. I do not ask to add a new row.

**what i expect is that when the agent update the instance properties to the oap server for now, the oap server should save the update into the latest indice which is meaningful rather than some older indice**

This is what you said. If not add a new row, how it is possible?

Hi, could you get your head clear? If there is no one updates the time bucket, there is no chance to insert another new record. 

I think this duplicate record is caused by ES is not queryable in the short term, then the OAP inserts a new one. This has nothing related to the source codes you posted.

Think again because you reply further. Or read your words again, they are against each other.
What is this PR for? Could you explain?

> and return 6 record right?

What do you mean 6 records? 

> if the MetricsPersistentWorker chose the skywalking-instance_traffic-20210726 docs to update everything is fine, but there is no code to make sure for that now

Choosing `skywalking-instance_traffic-20210726` is totally wrong. You can't update a row originally from 20210721 and make it updated in `*0726`. 
SkyWalking keep the time bucket unchanged, then the data is only updated in the original index(assume `0721`)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5441976/126947622-74865957-35b2-4364-889e-44184050a7c3.png)

The codes you posted are making against what you said later. That is what I mean, you don't get yourself clear.

https://github.com/apache/skywalking/pull/7179
last month I fix the reponse time of gRPC,and left some problems.

First and most importantly, no PMC care about that project anymore. Because no one actually is using it.
And OpenTracing has a bad practice about forwarding compatibility. All APIs are breaking, again and again, we can't see any benefit from it.
If you want, you could try, but for real, its latest APIs are very hard to follow from SkyWalking perspective. We tried 2 years ago, but fail.

> suppose notInCacheIds just has one element -> service_instance_id_xxxx, since we got 6 indices(0721~0726 like i supposed earlier), metricsDAO will return 6 records

I don't need to read the whole reply. This is already totally wrong. You should simulate the scenario from the beginning, rather than just guessing.  There are never 6 records in 5 indices for one instance. There is always only one, as the time bucket never changed.

I am going to keep saying the same thing. You take a lot of time to read codes and reply, but you forget the most important things, you do some wrong assumptions from the beginning.
Sorry, many things need to modify. Need to re-check compliance. After the modification is completed, the PR will be re-initiated
Thanks for submitting. Please update the changes.md in the root folder.

Conclusion to all people reading this thread later.

Don't be naive about the technology. From OpenTracing to OpenTelemetry, there is always a tricky term like a so-called unified solution for tracing. I don't want to waste time to argue whether this is possible or not, whether they(OpenTracing and OpenTelemetry are actually the same groups of people, except I and Adrian[Zipkin] exited) are doing right or wrong.

But at least, observability is not tracing. The APM is not just tracing. SkyWalking is doing a used-to-be commercial-level only tracing-based APM system, and now to extend to be a whole APM system including tracing/metrics/logging/event. Dapper is the paper 10+ years ago, the world changed for a long time, APM vendors and industry have a very clear conclusion, if you want to analysis topology and metrics in high performance from the tracing, Dapper-similar data format(Zipkin, Jaeger, anything) is not enough.

If you want to understand the real world, read the STAM paper, https://wu-sheng.github.io/STAM/, which is a thing designed for 2020, rather than 2000.

After trying to propagate a snapshot from `ConsumerDispatcher` to `Consumer`, I've found it doesn't work.ðŸ˜…

Because rabbit java client **does** work and does **not** cause broken traces. In another word, the existing plugin works well with java clients except `spring-rabbit`.(sry I didn't try other java clients before... ðŸ˜…)

The real reason for broken traces is that `spring-rabbit` using a container to dispatch listeners (in different threads) to consume rabbit messages. So adding a plugin to propagate snapshots from container to listeners should fix this issue and not conflict with the existing one.

Before doing all the above doc side changes, I want to ask, why this dynamic log should be a new module rather than a feature inside the core module? It looks like no other modules depend on this one, and there is no chance to switch to a new implementation.

> Before doing all the above doc side changes, I want to ask, why this dynamic log should be a new module rather than a feature inside the core module? It looks like no other modules depend on this one, and there is no chance to switch to a new implementation.

Dynamic logging depends on the `configuration` module. Can a core component support such a constraint?

After this PR, we need to support dynamic logging without `configuration`, a possible path is to inject log4j configuration through RESTful endpoint/GraphQL mutation, that's a new provider more than this one.

We don't that kind of doc. Sorry. Different storage implementations have different designs in different versions.
And from a community, no one contributed this kind of doc.

> 
> After this PR, we need to support dynamic logging without `configuration`, a possible path is to inject log4j configuration through RESTful endpoint/GraphQL mutation, that's a new provider more than this one.

Core module level HTTP Rest host:port should be a good way to host this service. The existing Query GraphQL isn't. 
Even you want to GraphQL level, it should not be a query protocol. We need to be careful about this kind of feature. CVE and security alert could be easy injected through this way.
We don't support that.
And you should update LAL script, right?

I know. I am afraid this could be misleading. Because `30qps * 60` is different with 1800rpm. In the worth case, you could get over 500qps sampled easily in some certain cases.
I think we should break the API in this release.
